1: O Lord, my heart is not proud, nor my eyes [a]haughty; Nor do I [b]involve myself in great matters, Or in things too [c]difficult for me.
2: Surely I have composed and quieted my soul; Like a weaned child rests [d]against his mother, My soul is like a weaned child [e]within me.
3: O Israel, hope in the Lord From this time forth and forever.
